lines.text: In Infinity Castle Tatami Hall, a shamisen pluck hits like a pulse. The air tightens, as if the building just woke up hungry.

lines.speaker: Castle String
lines.text: First pluck. Two left. On the third, every channel locks—and you stay outside forever.
A 16-year-old unmasked Intruder wakes on tatami, disoriented, staring at endless sliding doors with no stable up or down.

lines.speaker: Intruder
lines.text: Two plucks left… then I lose access.
She runs into the Shifting Tatami Corridor. The second pluck snaps in—axis tilts; she skids, catches a doorframe, and forces herself forward.
A door slides open to the Hydrogen Crowd collapsing in waves. Intruder steps over the threshold—gate wards snap and shove her back into the corridor.

lines.speaker: Intruder
lines.text: Locked out. Every room turns help into distance.
She yanks open the next shoji door—behind it, the Glass Water Chamber. Divers drift and recover slowly after the pluck, while rails and lattice glass block her path.
She slams it shut, staggers back into the corridor, and opens another door: the Sumo Tatami Ring. Heavy bodies rebound first—then ward chains lash the threshold and force her out again.
Breathing hard, she pushes onward and finds the Bone Pillar Gallery: practitioners rotate around a fixed pillar while a tense guard ring refuses entry.

lines.speaker: Intruder
lines.text: If I can’t enter… who can carry the signal inside?

lines.speaker: Castle String
lines.text: The third is already coming. Use the thread—if you dare. One pull, and they all hear. Miss it, and you watch them fall from outside.
Intruder anchors a taut thread to the bone pillar; the line hums faintly, stretching through door cracks like it belongs to the castle itself.
The corridor narrows as the Hydrogen Crowd streams toward a distant glow. Doors begin to seal in slow increments, as if the castle is practicing the lock.
She follows the flow to the Geisha Resource Dais. Geisha (Lure) lifts her fan; the rhythm steals one obedient step of strength from every group.

lines.speaker: Intruder
lines.text: Fast ones rise. Slow ones sink. Your rhythm turns bodies into a map.
The third pluck gathers like thunder behind the walls. Intruder grips the resonance thread, then steps through the narrowing doorway into the circle—choosing the only gate that still opens.

lines.speaker: Geisha (Lure)
lines.text: There you are. I felt you coming. Come closer—before the lock seals you out.
On the beat, Intruder plants her feet. The nearest hydrogen people stop collapsing and mirror her stance; the circle finally holds against the pull.

lines.speaker: Intruder
lines.text: Contrast doesn’t save you. It names you.
She lunges to Geisha (Lure) and stamps a gadolinium-contrast mark onto her wrist. Cyan paths flare outward, tracing hidden inflow through the crowd.
Twist beat: Geisha (Lure) freezes mid-gesture as the entire circle returns its gaze—no longer hypnotized, now accusing.

lines.speaker: Geisha (Lure)
lines.text: No… you were supposed to fall before the lock.
The full Hydrogen Crowd stands steady, resisting the pull together. The castle’s rhythm can’t drag them forward anymore.
Extreme close-up: Geisha (Lure) locks eyes with Intruder. Her pupils shake; cyan reflection fractures across her gaze in shock.
A katana slash rips across the frame like a surgical cut, leaving a blood-red streak over the Geisha’s eyes—then the image drops to black.

logline: With only three plucks before lock, an unmasked Intruder is blocked from early rooms and must coordinate through a resonance thread; at the final gate she enters Geisha Resource Dais, marks the Lure with contrast, and reveals hidden abnormal inflow early enough to change outcome.
theme: Time and access are part of diagnosis: predation hijacks attention through rhythm, while early MRI contrast and specialist coordination reveal hidden brain flow before collapse.
title: Infinity Castle: Three Plucks
